page.title: 20FAMILY LIFE,BANKS/CROSSENS
page.content: ALTHOUGH THE AREA OF BANKS AND CROSSENS HAS SEEN CONSIDERABLE NEW HOUSING DEVELOPMENT IN THE LAST TWO DECADES,IT STILL RETAINS A FAIRLY RURAL IDENTITY WITH A CLOSE COMMUNITY FEELING. TYPICAL RECREATIONAL PURSUITS PEOPLE GO TO ARE BOWLING,THE NEARBY LEISURE LAKES,FOOTBALL,LOCAL BINGO AND SOCIAL CLUBS.FACILITIES IN LOCAL TOWNS ARE USED ALSO - SUCH AS PARKS AND GARDENS, SWIMMING POOLS,SQUASH CLUBS,ETC. MOST FAMILIES HAVE A CAR ALTHOUGH BUS SERVICES ARE QUITE FREQUENT.WEEKENDS ARE OFTEN A TIME WHEN FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN DRIVE OUT TO PLACES SUCH AS THE LAKE DISTRICT. MEALTIMES STILL TEND TO BE FAMILY OCCASIONS.MEALS INCLUDE A HIGH TEA AT 5 - 6 O CLOCK AND A SUPPER LATER IN THE EVENING. VILLAGE AND COMMUNITY EVENTS ARE WELL ATTENDED AND MANY ARE LONG ESTABLISHED.
